marketNews.title: Rupiah Continues to Strengthen, Projected to Break Below 16,000
marketNews.content:
The Indonesian rupiah against the US dollar strengthened by 0.1% to 16,415 today, Tuesday (20/5), following news that the 2025 state budget (APBN) posted a surplus in the first four months after a deficit in the first quarter. The rally has lifted the rupiah by 2.8% since its low of 16,870 on 24 April 2025.

The recent appreciation coincides with improving global sentiment from the de-escalation of the US-China trade dispute and a weakening US dollar. Global sentiment also lifted the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) by 18.3% as of 20 May 2025 from its low of 5,996 on 8 April 2025, driven by a return of foreign inflows.

Bloomberg reported that analysts expect the rupiah’s uptrend to continue, mainly due to a weaker dollar and more prudent fiscal management in Indonesia. The dollar’s weakness is pressured by soft US economic data and investor concerns over US government debt, prompting portfolio diversification away from US markets.

TD Securities projects the rupiah could appreciate more than 4% in 4Q25 versus the Friday (16/5) close at 16,440. Citigroup Global Markets forecasts the rate to reach around 16,000 in 2026. ING Financial Markets is the most bullish, expecting the rupiah to reach 15,200 by the end of 2025.

A stronger rupiah gives Bank Indonesia more room to cut the BI Rate. Reuters consensus expects a 25-basis-point cut to 5.5% at the Board of Governors meeting on Wednesday (21/5) and another 25-basis-point cut to 5.25% by the end of 3Q25.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content:
1. The Ministry of Finance released the 2026 Macro-Economic Framework and Fiscal Policy Fundamentals (KEM-PPKF) on Tuesday (20/5). The 2026 framework targets GDP growth of 5.2-5.8% YoY, inflation of 1.5-3.5%, the rupiah at 16,500-16,900 per US dollar, an APBN deficit of 2.48-2.53% of GDP, crude oil price of $60-80 per barrel, oil lifting of 600,000-605,000 barrels per day, and gas lifting of 953-1,017 MBOEPD.

2. Finance Minister Sri Mulyani said the APBN posted a surplus of 4.3 trillion rupiah (0.02% of GDP) in the first four months of 2025, with a primary surplus of 173.9 trillion rupiah (-26.7% YoY). This marks a turnaround after a 104.2 trillion rupiah deficit in 1Q25. State revenue reached 810.5 trillion rupiah (-12.4% YoY) and expenditures 806.2 trillion rupiah (-5.1% YoY).

4. The People’s Republic of China’s central bank cut its 1-year and 5-year loan prime rates by 10 basis points to 3.0% and 3.5% respectively, the first such cuts since October 2024.

5. China’s national statistics bureau reported that urban youth unemployment (ages 16-24) fell to 15.8% in April 2025 (down from 16.5% in March).

6. Petronas’ Vice President of Exploration said the company is discussing a partnership with Pertamina and TotalEnergies to develop the Bobara oil block in West Papua. Talks have been ongoing since last year but no agreement has been signed yet.

7. Pertamina Geothermal Energy ($PGEO) plans to add laboratory testing services and commercialize a two-phase fluid measurement technology under the brand “Flow2Max.” The technology provides accurate real-time data on two-phase (steam-water) conditions in geothermal fluids.

tickerNews.title: CUAN Plans 1:10 Stock Split
tickerNews.content: $CUAN: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi plans a 1:10 stock split. The new nominal value will trade on the regular market and negotiations on 10 July 2025. The plan will be discussed at the Extraordinary General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPSLB) on 26 June 2025.

tickerNews.title: SMGR Reports 37% YoY Cement Sales Growth in April 2025
tickerNews.content: $SMGR: Semen Indonesia recorded a 37% YoY increase in cement sales in April 2025, supported by a 34% YoY rise in domestic cement sales. Excluding the Lebaran seasonality effect by aggregating March and April data, SMGR’s sales volume still grew 4.1% YoY. Bagged cement sales rose to 74.7% in April 2025 (vs. 69.4% in March) and 72.2% over 4M25 (vs. 71.5% in 3M25). Over 4M25, SMGR’s sales volume grew 1.2% YoY (vs. -3.4% YoY in 4M24), outperforming the industry which fell 1.3% YoY (vs. +0.3% YoY in 4M24).

tickerNews.title: MLBI Announces 2024 Dividend of ~1.1 Trillion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: $MLBI: Multi Bintang Indonesia will distribute a 2024 dividend of approximately 1.1 trillion rupiah, equivalent to a 100% dividend payout ratio. This translates to a final dividend of 352 rupiah per share and a final dividend yield of 5.7% as of Tuesday (20/5). The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiations on 26 May 2025, with payment on 19 June 2025. Previously, MLBI paid an interim dividend for FY2024 of 190 rupiah per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: GOTO Public Policy Head Addresses Online Ride-Hailing Demonstrations
tickerNews.content: $GOTO: The Chief of Public Policy & Government Relations at GoTo Gojek Tokopedia, Ade Mulya, said Gojek’s operations remain normal despite online ride-hailing (ojol) protests on 20 May 2025. Regarding the demand to reduce the commission or service fee to 10%, Ade argued that the existing 20% fee funds various initiatives such as order sustainability, customer promotions, driver incentives, and travel insurance. He also clarified that the government recognizes ojol drivers as partners, not employees, preserving the flexibility preferred by most drivers.

tickerNews.title: ERAA Reports -15.1% Same-Store Sales Growth in 1Q25
tickerNews.content: $ERAA: In its 1Q25 earnings call on Tuesday (20/5), Erajaya Swasembada reported a same-store sales growth (SSSG) decline of 15.1% YoY, continuing a weakening trend from 4Q24 (-17% YoY) and 2024 (-2.1% YoY), mainly due to the delayed launch of the iPhone 16 in Indonesia. Excluding all iPhone 15 sales in 1Q24, ERAA’s revenue still grew 13.5% YoY in 1Q25 (vs. a -4.6% YoY actual). ERAA targets opening 250-300 new stores in 2025, with roughly 200 digital-segment stores, 60-70 ‘active lifestyle’ stores, and 40 F&B stores.

tickerNews.title: ACES Reports -14.1% Same-Store Sales Growth in April 2025
tickerNews.content: $ACES: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia recorded a same-store sales growth (SSSG) of -14.1% YoY in April 2025 (vs. +8.6% YoY in March 2025 and +6.8% YoY in April 2024), pressured by Lebaran seasonality. Consequently, 4M25 SSSG fell -2.3% YoY (vs. +11.4% YoY in 4M24), missing the 2025 target of >+1% YoY. During 4M25, SSSG slowed across all regions: outside Java -0.5% YoY, Java outside Jakarta -3% YoY, and Jakarta -4% YoY.

tickerNews.title: DILD Reports 85% YoY Increase in Marketing Sales in 1Q25
tickerNews.content: $DILD: Intiland Development recorded marketing sales of 469.2 billion rupiah in 1Q25, an 85% YoY increase, representing 23.5% of the 2025 target of 2 trillion rupiah. Approximately 88% of marketing sales came from industrial estate segments, with the remaining split among mixed-use/high-rise (7%) and land-based housing (5%).

tickerNews.title: MARK Announces 2024 Dividend of 266 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: $MARK: Mark Dynamics Indonesia will distribute a 2024 dividend of 266 billion rupiah, equivalent to approximately a 93% dividend payout ratio. This translates to a final dividend of 30 rupiah per share and a final dividend yield of 3.7% as of Tuesday (20/5). The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiations on 26 May 2025, with payment on 19 June 2025. Previously, MARK paid interim dividends for FY2024 in September 2024 and December 2024, each of 20 rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: ANJT Receives 1.6 Trillion Rupiah Credit Facility from BBCA
tickerNews.content: $ANJT: Austindo Nusantara Jaya obtained a credit facility of 1.6 trillion rupiah from Bank Central Asia ($BBCA) to support financial management and operational needs. The facility carries a 7% annual interest rate and matures on 12 August 2026.

tickerNews.title: NICL Targets 104% YoY Net Profit Growth in 2025
tickerNews.content: $NICL: PAM Mineral aims for a 104% YoY increase in net profit in 2025, targeting 650 billion rupiah, supported by a 43% YoY nickel sales growth target of 3.3 million tonnes. The company also plans to acquire PT Sumber Mineral Abadi to boost production, pending approval from the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources. As of 1Q25, NICL has signed a conditional share purchase agreement for a 50% stake in PT Sumber Mineral Abadi valued at 650 billion rupiah, with 125 billion rupiah already paid as a down-payment.

tickerNews.content: Strengthening rupiah provides larger room for Bank Indonesia to cut rates, which is expected to positively impact Big 4 banks $BBCA.

tickerNews.title: PEHA Mentioned in Government Official Rotation
tickerNews.content: Kontan reported that Bimo Wijayanto will be appointed as Director General of Tax, replacing Suryo Utomo. Bimo currently serves as an independent commissioner at Phapros ($PEHA).

tickerNews.title: PGEO Plans New Business Activities in Flow2Max Technology
tickerNews.content: Pertamina Geothermal Energy ($PGEO) plans to add laboratory testing services and commercialize a two-phase fluid measurement technology under the brand “Flow2Max,” which provides accurate real-time data on steam-water conditions in geothermal fluids.

tickerNews.title: BCAP Plans Rights Issue of ~21.3 Billion New Shares
tickerNews.content: MNC Kapital Indonesia ($BCAP) intends to conduct a rights issue of approximately 21.3 billion new shares, resulting in a dilution of up to 33.33%. The issue price has not been announced; proceeds will be used for working capital and business development.
